case_title: Muhammad Raza Khan, Mst. Parveen vs Government of N.-W.F.P. through Secretary Home and Tribal Affairs, Peshawar and 5 others
respondant: Government of N.-W.F.P. through Secretary Home and Tribal Affairs, Peshawar

accussed_details.name: Gul Rehman
allegation: Failure to pay penalties imposed under Section 514 Cr.P.C.
Absconding of accused released on bail in 13 cases

complaint_summary: The petitioner, Mst. Parveen, filed a habeas corpus petition challenging the detention of her husband, Gul Rehman, at Central Jail Peshawar due to penalties imposed under Section 514 Cr.P.C. for absconding accused in 13 cases.
investigation_summary: Details of detention periods and penalties were provided by the Superintendent Central Jail Peshawar. Eight detention periods had expired, while five were pending. The probable release date was calculated as 30-06-2006.

judgment_summary.petition_type: Constitutional petition in the nature of habeas corpus
judgment_summary.detention_reason: Failure to pay penalties imposed under Section 514 Cr.P.C.
key_issues: Eligibility for remissions under Jail Manual and Presidential orders.

court_findings.remissions: Detenu not entitled to remissions as imprisonment under Section 514(4) Cr.P.C. is not considered a sentence.
court_findings.concurrent_imprisonment: Periods of imprisonment under Section 514(4) Cr.P.C. should run concurrently unless otherwise stated.

judgment_summary.release_order: Detenu Gul Rehman to be released immediately if not required in any other case.

punishment: Imprisonment for various terms under Section 514 Cr.P.C., now deemed completed due to concurrent running of detention periods.
Decision_or_verdict: Writ petition allowed; Gul Rehman ordered to be released immediately.
legal_arguments: Imprisonment under Section 514(4) Cr.P.C. is not a sentence and does not qualify for remissions.
Detention periods should run concurrently, not consecutively, in the absence of statutory provisions.
statutes: Article 45 of the Constitution of Pakistan
key_issues: Eligibility for remissions under Jail Manual and Presidential orders.

maxims.Sentence Definition: A direction by which punishment is prescribed and meted out to a person convicted of an offence.

legal_terms.Civil Prisoner: Defined under Rule 402(ii) of the Prison Rules.
legal_terms.Remission System: Defined under Rule 199 of the Prison Rules.

words_and_phrases.Imprisonment: Not all imprisonments are punishments under Section 57 P.P.C.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the detention of Gul Rehman under Section 514 Cr.P.C. The court ruled that such imprisonment is not a sentence and does not qualify for remissions. Detention periods were directed to run concurrently, leading to the immediate release of the detenu.
